body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky:

The petitioner James A Hart would respectfully show to your Excellency that at the July Term of the City Court of Louisville He was indicted by the name of George Hart for assault & Battery upon an Irishman by the name of Fitzpatrick that He was fined the sum of $2500 & costs: at the August Term of said Court Your petitioner states that He is a young man and without means and out employment: At the time of the difficulty He was employed at Craven's Ice Depot on 5th Street in the city of Louisville and he went into a shed for a private purpose and whilst there Fitzpatrick ran into the shed and wanted to Know what petitioner was doing there in this stable. He saw what petitioner was doing: and without further cerimony pitched into your petitioner, and then hastily indicted your petitioner for assault &c and of course had the and petitioner could not be heard and so your petitioner was fined as above stated:
He humbly asks your Excellency to remit the fine, and will ever pray &c

State of Kentucky
Jef County Sct
James A Hart says the above petition is true
Subscribed and sworn to before me ths 24th day of oct 1865

Jos Clement J. P C C
Pat Dillon M, C, C, L
T. Jack Conn clk
H Jeff co ct
Henry Evans
